connector.description:
Query data from an Oracle Database.

In your Pipe file, you must explicitly declare the Oracle Database driver dependency in spec->integration->dependencies.

- "mvn:com.oracle.database.jdbc:ojdbc11:<version>"

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.ser.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.serverName
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.ser.description: The server name for the data source. Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.ser.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.serverPort
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.ser.description: The server port for the data source.

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.use.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.username
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.use.description: The username to access a secured Oracle Database.

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.pas.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.password
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.pas.description: The password to access a secured Oracle Database.

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.que.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.query
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.que.description: The query to execute against the Oracle Database. Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.dat.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.databaseName
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.dat.description: The name of the Oracle Database.

camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.con.name: camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.consumedQuery
camel.kamelet.oracle-database-source.con.description: A query to run on a tuple consumed. Example: DELETE FROM accounts where user_id = :#user_id
